attributes.action: Review the student nurse bursary: take into account people's circumstances
attributes.additional_details: The current bursary for student nurses in Northern Ireland is just £430 a month, which doesn’t reflect the immense workload we face. Between university classes, exams, essays, placements, and NiPad (our placement record), we’re juggling a lot. We can do up to five shifts a week, but even if we work extra, our bursary is still far from enough to cover living expenses—especially for those with families, rent, or mortgages to pay. It works out at £2/hour - nowhere near minimum wage. It isn’t fair
attributes.background: Review the current bursary for student nurses in Northern Ireland, which is just £430 a month and doesn’t reflect the immense workload we face. It should take into account peoples personal circumstances - especially those with families, rent or experiencing hardship. It is nowhere near enough money.

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Northern Ireland Executive is responsible for. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it.  

If you want to raise this issue you could contact your MLA, or raise it with the Northern Ireland Executive. 

You can find contact details for your MLAs here: http://www.niassembly.gov.uk/your-mlas/ 

You can find contact details for the departments of the Northern Ireland Executive here: https://www.nidirect.gov.uk/contacts/government-departments-in-northern-ireland
